title: PRD ReDesign: Error Pages (404 / 500 / 502)
context: Error pages are part of the user experience, not just a technical fallback. When users hit a broken or unavailable page, they experience frustration, uncertainty, and sometimes distrust. Our responsibility is to turn that negative moment into a reassuring, helpful, and brand-consistent experience.
personas: New visitors: Users arriving from organic search, ads, or backlinks
Returning customers: Users who have purchased or consulted before
High intent users: Users in checkout or consultation flow when error occurred
Support seekers: Users seeking information about delivery, accounts, or prescriptions

404_page_not_found.context: This page appears when a user follows a broken link, mistypes a URL, or accesses a page that no longer exists.

content_messaging.headline: Page Not Found or We can't seem to find that page.
content_messaging.body_copy: Sorry, the page you're looking for doesn't exist or may have been moved.
content_messaging.image: A clean, on-brand graphic, e.g a stylized, empty.

buttons_actions.primary_button: Go to Homepage - main recovery route

500_502_server_error.context: This occurs when DoktorABC experiences a temporary backend failure or technical issue. The user did nothing wrong, our responsibility is to reassure them and guide them safely.

content_messaging.headline: Something went wrong on our end.
content_messaging.body_copy: We're sorry, but we're experiencing a temporary technical issue. Our team has been automatically notified and is working to fix it. Please try refreshing the page in a few moments.

buttons_actions.primary_button: Refresh This Page - since 500 errors are often temporary, this is the main action
buttons_actions.secondary_button: Go to Homepage - backup route if refresh doesn't resolve it
buttons_actions.key_link: Contact Support - critical for users in checkout or consultation
